page.title: 02The Village Hall,Horningsham
page.content: The{Village Hall}which is situated on the main road was built in 1930 at a cost of #8000 by the then{Lord Bath} in memory of his mother, is used by different clubs and organisations. Among them are the Womens Institute, a Youth Club and a very successful Luncheon Club. The hall can hold 160 people though in former times the limit was 200; the reduction coming as a result of new fire regulations. There is a well equipped stage which is used from time to time by local amature groups for plays and pantomimes. The{Parish Council}hold their meetings in a small room above the main hall. The hall is administered by a special committee.
